paper_title.ja: 繰返し水平力を受けるコンクリート充填鋼管構造骨組の付着性状に関する実験的研究
paper_title.en: BOND BEHAVIOR OF CONCRETE FILLED STEEL TUBULAR FRAMES UNDER CYCLIC HORIZONTAL LOAD

description.ja: Tests were carried out on six frame specimens consisted of square concrete filled steel tubular (CFT) columns and H-shape steel beams. These specimens were open frames which included one-bay and two-story. These specimens were around one-fourth scaling model of lower part of a prototype model structure. The steel tube of the column was 150x150x4.5mm with square section, and the steel beam were H-150x90x6x6mm and H-150x150x6x9mm. They were subjected to cyclic lateral load at the beam of the second story under constant axial load. The main objective of the tests was to investigate the seismic behavior of the CFT frames basically. In particular, the bond behavior of the inside wall of the square steel tube and inner concrete was also studied. The test parameters were mechanical slip stopper, vacant space of the top of the columns and magnitude of axial load ratio. The load-deformation relations and the transfers of sustained axial force of steel tubes were investigated corresponding to the specimens with different types of mechanism of the stress-transfer between steel tube and concrete.
description.en: Tests were carried out on six frame specimens consisted of square concrete filled steel tubular (CFT) columns and H-shape steel beams. These specimens were open frames which included one-bay and two-story. These specimens were around one-fourth scaling model of lower part of a prototype model structure. The steel tube of the column was 150x150x4.5mm with square section, and the steel beam were H-150x90x6x6mm and H-150x150x6x9mm. They were subjected to cyclic lateral load at the beam of the second story under constant axial load. The main objective of the tests was to investigate the seismic behavior of the CFT frames basically. In particular, the bond behavior of the inside wall of the square steel tube and inner concrete was also studied. The test parameters were mechanical slip stopper, vacant space of the top of the columns and magnitude of axial load ratio. The load-deformation relations and the transfers of sustained axial force of steel tubes were investigated corresponding to the specimens with different types of mechanism of the stress-transfer between steel tube and concrete.

paper_title.ja: プレストレスを導入したコンクリート充填円形鋼管の曲げ性状
paper_title.en: BENDING BEHAVIOR OF PRE-STRESSED CONCRETE-FILLED STEEL TUBE

description.ja: Concrete filled steel tubes (CFT) are widely used in Japan as beam-columns for high-rise building frames because of the high stiffness, strength and deformability in comparison with the other structural members such as shaped-steel sections or vacant steel tubular sections. In this study, a CFT member with a pre-tensioned steel wire is proposed. In the member, an asphalt thin layer is placed on between steel tube and filled concrete, so that the no bond effect between those is expected. A pre-tensioned steel wire si placed at the center of a CFT section, which introduces the compressive pre-stress into the filled concrete. The bending test has been done, where the vertical load applies monotonically at the mid span of a simple supported beam composed of a CFT member with steel wire. The test parameters are (1) the diameter-to-thickness ratio (Dlt); and (2) the ratio of the pretension force to the axial strength of CFT section. The test revealed that the strength increased when the proper pre-tension force was introduced; the elastic flexural stiffness of the member was adequately evaluated by a simple summation of the concrete stiffness and the steel tube stiffness; and the prediction formulae specified in the present Japanese codes under-estimated or over-estimated by Dlt both the yield strength and the maximum strength of the specimen. Therefore, new strength prediction formulae have been proposed based on the test results.
description.en: Concrete filled steel tubes (CFT) are widely used in Japan as beam-columns for high-rise building frames because of the high stiffness, strength and deformability in comparison with the other structural members such as shaped-steel sections or vacant steel tubular sections. In this study, a CFT member with a pre-tensioned steel wire is proposed. In the member, an asphalt thin layer is placed on between steel tube and filled concrete, so that the no bond effect between those is expected. A pre-tensioned steel wire si placed at the center of a CFT section, which introduces the compressive pre-stress into the filled concrete. The bending test has been done, where the vertical load applies monotonically at the mid span of a simple supported beam composed of a CFT member with steel wire. The test parameters are (1) the diameter-to-thickness ratio (Dlt); and (2) the ratio of the pretension force to the axial strength of CFT section. The test revealed that the strength increased when the proper pre-tension force was introduced; the elastic flexural stiffness of the member was adequately evaluated by a simple summation of the concrete stiffness and the steel tube stiffness; and the prediction formulae specified in the present Japanese codes under-estimated or over-estimated by Dlt both the yield strength and the maximum strength of the specimen. Therefore, new strength prediction formulae have been proposed based on the test results.

paper_title.ja: Earthquake Response of CFT Frames Forming an Inner-column Yield Mechanism
コンクリート充填鋼管柱の有孔ダイヤフラムによるずれ止め効果の定量的評価
paper_title.en: A QUANTITATIVE EVALUATION OF THE STRESS TRANSFER EFFECT BETWEEN STEEL TUBE AND INFILL CONCRETE BY HORIZONTAL DIAPHRAGMS IN A CFT COLUMN

description.ja: With regard to moment-resistant frames installed by diagonal braces, the strong axial force is introduced into a column from diagonal braces at a beam-to-column connection. When the column is made of CFT (concrete-filled steel tube), the axial force from braces firstly transfer to the steel tubular portion of the column. If the steel and concrete composite action is expected, a certain component of the axial force should transfer to the filled concrete. Two types of stress transfer mechanisms may be available in CFT columns. The one is the concrete bond to steel tube, and the other is a mechanical shear key functioned by the cut-through diaphragm which is often used for beam-to-column connections in Japan. The paper presents the quantitative effect of diaphragm shear key and the evaluation method in practice.
description.en: With regard to moment-resistant frames installed by diagonal braces, the strong axial force is introduced into a column from diagonal braces at a beam-to-column connection. When the column is made of CFT (concrete-filled steel tube), the axial force from braces firstly transfer to the steel tubular portion of the column. If the steel and concrete composite action is expected, a certain component of the axial force should transfer to the filled concrete. Two types of stress transfer mechanisms may be available in CFT columns. The one is the concrete bond to steel tube, and the other is a mechanical shear key functioned by the cut-through diaphragm which is often used for beam-to-column connections in Japan. The paper presents the quantitative effect of diaphragm shear key and the evaluation method in practice.

paper_title.en: A METHOD TO IMPROVE DISTRIBUTION OF STORY DRIFT ANGLE RESPONSES IN CFT MOMENT-RESISTANT FRAMES UNDER SEVERE EARTHQUAKES

description.ja: As the performance-based design will be widely used, it will be more necessary for a frame to be evaluated by the responses obtained from a dynamic analysis. In this paper, we proposed a simple method to modify the story shear strength so as to make the story drift distribution smooth over the building height, being based on a pre-calculated story responses. The method is derived from the theory of damage concentration by Akiyama. The applicability of the method was confirmed by a numerical calculation of a full nonlinear frame analysis.
description.en: As the performance-based design will be widely used, it will be more necessary for a frame to be evaluated by the responses obtained from a dynamic analysis. In this paper, we proposed a simple method to modify the story shear strength so as to make the story drift distribution smooth over the building height, being based on a pre-calculated story responses. The method is derived from the theory of damage concentration by Akiyama. The applicability of the method was confirmed by a numerical calculation of a full nonlinear frame analysis.

paper_title.ja: CFT３層骨組の弾塑性変形性状に関する実験的研究
paper_title.en: EXPERIMENTAL STUDY ON ELASTIC-PLASTIC BEHAVIOR OF CFT THREE-STORY FRAMES

description.ja: Three story and one span CFT frames were tested under the constant vertical and alternately repeated horizontal loads in order to study the seismic performance of multi story CFT frames. In this paper, the effects of steel shear walls and beam-to-column connection types (an external diaphragm connection type and a new connection type) on the elastic-plastic behavior of CFT frames are discussed. CFT frames showed large ductile behavior, whereas 1st story columns were subjected to alternately large compressive and tensile axial load. In a steel tube frame, local buckling occurred at column top and column base on the 1st story at a drift angle R=2/100 rad, and after which the strength decreased rapidly.
description.en: Three story and one span CFT frames were tested under the constant vertical and alternately repeated horizontal loads in order to study the seismic performance of multi story CFT frames. In this paper, the effects of steel shear walls and beam-to-column connection types (an external diaphragm connection type and a new connection type) on the elastic-plastic behavior of CFT frames are discussed. CFT frames showed large ductile behavior, whereas 1st story columns were subjected to alternately large compressive and tensile axial load. In a steel tube frame, local buckling occurred at column top and column base on the 1st story at a drift angle R=2/100 rad, and after which the strength decreased rapidly.

research_project_title.ja: 巨大地震を受ける超高層建物の応答性状と損傷評価に関する研究

description.ja: 長周期成分を含む巨大地震下の超高層建物の応答性状を時刻歴応答解析で調査する．建物は鉄骨構造、合成構造、ＲＣ構造であり、それぞれの局所不安定性を表現できる部材要素を開発し、それぞれの損傷則を明らにし、超高層骨組の耐震性を評価する。

research_project_title.ja: 内蔵鉄筋CFT接合部の開発

description.ja: コンクリート充填鋼管（CFT）に高強度鉄筋を内蔵することで、鋼管の溶接を必要としない接合部が可能となる。特に柱継手や柱脚では経済性、施工性が大幅に改善される。
